question: Question_07_(a)
statement:
The equation

\[\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0\\ 0& 1\\ 1& 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_{1}\\ x_{2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 2\\ 3 \end{bmatrix}\]

has no solution.

\textbf{(a)} Find the \emph{least squares} solution.
sols:
Solve \emph{A\textsuperscript{T}Ax = A\textsuperscript{T}b} for
\emph{x}.

\[\begin{bmatrix} 1 &0 &1 \\ 0& 1 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0\\ 0 & 1\\ 1 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_{1}\\ x_{2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 &0 &1 \\ 0& 1 & 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 2\\ 3 \end{bmatrix}\]
$\begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1\\ 1& 2 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_{1}\\ x_{2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 4\\ 5 \end{bmatrix}$

Create an augmented matrix:

\[\begin{bmatrix}
2 & 1 & 4\\ 
1& 2 & 5
\end{bmatrix}\]

Row reduce to find the solution for \emph{x} to get
$\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0 & 1\\ 0&1 &2 \end{bmatrix}$

\[x = \begin{bmatrix} x_{1}\\ x_{2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 2 \end{bmatrix}\]

is the least squares solution.
